newsitem.title: USA: NOTICE OF SALE -- Georgia $307 mln GO bonds.
newsitem.headline: NOTICE OF SALE -- Georgia $307 mln GO bonds.

text.p: OFFICIAL NOTICE OF SALE
STATE OF GEORGIA
GENERAL OBLIGATION BONDS, 1997A
SEALED BIDS will be received and publicly opened by the undersigned at Suite 214, 254 Washington Street, Atlanta, Georgia, at 11:00 o'clock A.M. on Tuesday,
April 8, 1997

for all but no part of the above captioned bonds, dated April 1, 1997. The bonds will be issued only as fully- registered bonds in denominations of $5,000 each or any whole multiple thereof. Both principal and semiannual (April 1 and October 1) interest are payable at The Bank of New York. The bonds mature on April 1 as follows:
THE BONDS OF THIS ISSUE ARE NONCALLABLE.

The bonds are issued by the Georgia State Financing and Investment Commission for and on behalf of the State of Georgia pursuant to powers granted to the Commission in the Constitution of the State of Georgia, the Act creating the Commission and an authorizing resolution of the Commission. The bonds so issued constitute direct and general
obligations of the State of Georgia for the payment of which the full faith, credit and taxing power of the State are pledged.

Delivery of the bonds will be made in New York, New York as soon as the bonds can be validated and prepared, which is estimated to be April 24, 1997. However, the purchaser shall allow 50 days for delivery. Payment for the bonds shall be made in federal funds.

The bonds are offered subject to validation by the Superior Court of Fulton County, Georgia, and delivery will be accompanied by an execution, signature and no-litigation certificate and non-arbitrage certificate. The legality of the proceedings and the bonds will be approved by

Sutherland, Asbill & Brennan, L.L.P., Atlanta, Georgia, the cost of whose approving opinion shall be paid by the State. The legal opinion of Sutherland, Asbill & Brennan, L.L.P. will be printed on the bonds.

Bidders may name the rate or rates of interest the bonds are to bear in multiples of 1/20th of 1%, with no greater difference than 4% between the highest and lowest rates named and no interest rate shall exceed 6.25% per annum. All bonds of each maturity must bear a single rate. No bid for less than par and accrued interest will be considered.
Any bid providing for supplemental coupons will no

considered, and all bonds must bear interest to maturity. The lowest and best bid will be determined by calculating the total interest on all bonds from April 1, 1997 to date of maturity, less any premium.
Instructions relating to certificate registration and denominations must be forwarded so as to be received by the Registrar Bank no later than April 18, 1997.
Within 48 hours after the award of the bonds, the successful bidder shall submit to the Commission a

certificate, in form and substance satisfactory to Bond Counsel, specifying for each maturity the expected bona fide reoffering price of the bonds of each maturity, as of the date of the award of the bid. Prior to delivery of the bonds, the successful bidder must submit to the Commission a certificate, in form and substance satisfactory to Bond Counsel, stating that a bona fide offering of the bonds was made to the public at the prices indicated in the first certificate, certifying the actual re-offering price of at least 10% of the bonds of each maturity, and identifying the amounts, maturities, and prices at which any bonds were actually sold to institutions or other investors at a discount from the offering prices to the public. For purposes of this paragraph, sales of bonds to other
securities brokers or dealers will not be counted as sales to the public.
A Preliminary Official Statement for the bonds has been prepared by the Commission. The Preliminary Official

Statement is deemed by the Commission to be final for the purposes of compliance with Rule 15c2-12 of the Securities and Exchange Commission. In order to assist bidders in complying with Securities and Exchange Commission Rule 15c2- 12(b)(5) (the Rule''), the State will undertake, pursuant to the resolution authorizing the issuance of the bonds and a Continuing Disclosure Certificate, to provide annual reports and notices of material events in accordance with the provisions of the Rule. A description of this

undertaking is set forth in Appendix E of the Preliminary Official Statement and will be set forth in the final Official Statement. The State's failure to deliver the Continuing Disclosure Certificate on the date of issuance and delivery of the bonds shall relieve the successful bidder of its obligation to purchase the bonds.

The Commission designates the senior managing underwriter of the syndicate to which the bonds are awarded (the Purchaser'') as its agent for purposes of distributing copies of the final Official Statement to each participating underwriter. Any underwriter executing and delivering a Bid Form with respect to this issue agrees that, if its bid is accepted by the Commission: (1) to accept such designation; (2) to contact all participating underwriters for the purpose of assuring proper dissemination of the final Official Statement; and (3) to provide to the Commission, within two (2) days after the date of the sale, all
necessary pricing information and underwriter identific needed to complete the final Official Statement.

Upon receipt of this information, the Commission will prepare and provide to the Purchaser, within seven (7) business days after the sale, a sufficient number of copies of the final Official Statement. The final Official
Statement will be in substantially the same form as the preliminary document, subject to any additions, deletions, or revisions that the Commission believes are necessary.
The right is reserved to reject any and all bids, and bids shall be submitted upon the Bid Form furnished by the Georgia State Financing and Investment Commission and
enclosed in a sealed envelope marked on the outside
PROPOSAL FOR 1997A BONDS.'' The Commission reserves the right to waive informalities in any and all bids.

A good faith deposit in the amount of $3,071,950 shall be made by each bidder in the form of a certified, treasurer's, or cashier's check payable to the order of the Georgia State Financing and Investment Commission. The deposit of the successful bidder will be applied on the purchase price of the bonds or retained by the Commission as liquidated damages to it should the bidder fail to comply with the terms of the bid. All checks of unsuccessful bidders will be returned upon the acceptance of the successful bid, or within 24 hours. No interest will be paid on any good faith deposit.

Preliminary Official Statements, including Notice of Sale and Bid Form, have been mailed to a list of prospective bidders and institutional investors. Further information and details are available upon request from the Georgia State Financing and Investment Commission, 254 Washington Street, Suite 214, Atlanta, Georgia 30334 (telephone 404-656-2174).
